page.title: 13FARMLAND (GRASSLAND)
page.content: A large amount of the farmland in this area is grassland. The park at Hazlegrove, which is about 200 acres, is used purely as grazing land for beef cattle. In the autumn pigs are also let lose to feed on the acorns from the oak trees. Also in this area there are large amounts of grazing land for dairy cattle. However the grass used for dairy cattle is much richer than the harsher grass used for beef cattle. There is also grassland used for sheep grazing but huge fields are not used. Orchards, as the trees have either fallen down or died, have been used for sheep grazing on a small scale. Many people ride horses in our area and about five acres is dedicated for horse grazing.
